intro: Gentiana acuta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gentiana acuta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects such as bees and butterflies.
